articles.title: Kim Jong Un Has Photo Session
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Has Photo Session 
 Pyongyang, April 17 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, had a photo session with the participants in the 4th Conference of the WPK and the representatives for celebrating the centenary of the birth of President Kim Il Sung.
					  Present there were senior party, state and army officials Kim Yong Nam, Choe Yong Rim, Choe Ryong Hae, Ri Yong Ho, Kim Kyong Hui, Kim Jong Gak, Jang Song Thaek, Kim Yong Chun, Pak To Chun, Kim Kuk Thae, Kim Ki Nam, Choe Thae Bok, Yang Hyong Sop, Ri Yong Mu, Kang Sok Ju, Hyon Chol Hae, Kim Won Hong, Ri Myong Su and veteran anti-Japanese fighters Ri Ul Sol, Hwang Sun Hui and Kim Chol Man.
					
					 He warmly congratulated the participants in the conference and the representatives who have devoted themselves to the strengthening and development of the party and the prosperity of the country and had a picture taken with them.
					
					 He expressed expectation and belief that just as they have dynamically advanced only along the path of revolution following the party single-mindedly, they would creditably play the vanguard role in the revolution and construction in the future, too and thus successfully fulfill their honorary mission and duty as vanguard fighters in accomplishing the revolutionary cause of Songun.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Has Picture Taken with Builders of People's Theatre
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Has Picture Taken with Builders of People's Theatre 
 Pyongyang, April 17 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, had a picture taken with soldier-builders and designers of the People's Theatre who successfully built the theatre as a grand monumental edifice in the era of Songun on the occasion of the 100th birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung. 
					 Present at the photo session were Choe Ryong Hae, Jang Song Thaek and Kim Won Hong. 
					
					 Kim Jong Un warmly congratulated them on their proud labor feats performed in the building of the theatre by fully displaying the revolutionary soldier spirit before having a picture taken with them. 
					
					 He repeatedly appreciated their shining feats, saying that the above-said soldier-builders and designers successfully built many monumental edifices in the past, thus powerfully demonstrating the might of Juche Korea before the whole world and making a great contribution to the prosperity of the country. 
					
					 He expressed great satisfaction over the fact that they successfully completed the theatre in a matter of less than a year and creditably implemented the behest of General Secretary Kim Jong Il, noting that he conceived the plan for its construction more than 10 years back and paid special attention to its project in the last period of his life to make sure that it was built as a gift of loyalty to the 100th birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung and provided to the people. 
					
					 He expressed expectation and belief that they would fully display patriotic devotion and popular heroism in the socialist construction in the future, too, and thus make a positive contribution to the cause of building a thriving nation.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Has Photo Session with Service Personnel of Kumsusan Palace of Sun
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Has Photo Session with Service Personnel of Kumsusan Palace of Sun
 Pyongyang, April 17 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, had a photo session with the service personnel of the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun.
					 Present there were senior party, state and army officials Choe Ryong Hae, Ri Yong Ho, Kim Jong Gak, Jang Song Thaek, Hyon Chol Hae and Kim Won Hong.
					
					 Kim Jong Un warmly congratulated the service personnel who have displayed intense loyalty in the work to preserve with best care and manage the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun as an eternal holy site of the sun before having a photo session with them.
					
					 He expressed expectation and conviction that the service personnel would as ever creditably discharge their honorable mission and duty in the struggle for holding President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il in high esteem for all ages and glorify the glorious revolutionary history of the peerlessly great men and their immortal exploits.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Greets Syrian President
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Greets Syrian President
 Pyongyang, April 17 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, on Sunday sent a message of greeting to President of Syria Bashar Al－Assad, regional secretary of the Syria's Baath Arab Socialist Party.
					 The message said:
					
					 I would like to extend heartfelt greetings to you and your friendly government and people on the occasion of the 66th independence day, the national holiday of the Syrian people.
					
					 Our people have invariably supported the Syrian people in their just cause of defending the sovereignty and achieving peace, stability and development of the country.
					
					 I hope that you will achieve success in your responsible work, in the belief that the traditional friendly and cooperative relations between our two countries will steadily grow stronger.

articles.title: UNSC's Act to Violate DPRK's Legitimate Right to Launch Satellite Rejected: DPRK FM
articles.content:
DPRK Rejects UNSC's Act to Violate DPRK's Legitimate Right to Launch Satellite
 Pyongyang, April 17 (KCNA) -- The DPRK Foreign Ministry Tuesday issued the following statement:
					 The U.S. and its followers committed a hostile act of violating the DPRK's right to satellite launch by abusing the United Nations Security Council again.
					
					 On April 16 the UNSC issued a statement of its chairman "condemning" the DPRK's satellite launch for peaceful purposes.
					
					 The DPRK took steps to show the sincerity and transparency of the satellite launch for peaceful purposes to the maximum from A to Z as an exception and aroused sympathy of broad world public.
					
					 The U.S., finding it hard to conceal the truth, after hatching all sorts of dastardly trick to prevent the peaceful nature of the DPRK's satellite launch from being confirmed objectively and persistently term it a long-range missile launch, imposed upon the UNSC its brigandish demand that the DPRK should not be allowed to launch even a satellite for peaceful purposes.
					
					 The UNSC has been abused under the pressure of high-handed and arbitrary practices of the U.S. and its catastrophic consequences have been felt still today in various parts of the world. 
					
					 UNSC resolutions 1718 and 1874 which the hostile forces regard as the "ground" to take issue with the DPRK's satellite launch are a product of their high-handed policy for antagonizing and oppressing the DPRK and the height of illegality they faked up at random, disregarding even universally accepted international law.
					
					 It is the brigandish essence of these resolutions that those countries which refuse to meekly obey the U.S. should not be allowed to develop their national defence capability and to this end they should be deprived of even their right to launch satellites for peaceful purposes.
					
					 Such unreasonable double standards are possible at the UNSC because such standards are in line with the interests of those countries keen to monopolize such cutting-edge technology as satellite launch.
					
					 The present developments clearly show that the principle of equality as regards sovereignty clarified in the UN Charter is a mere high-sounding word and justice should be protected by one's own efforts.
					
					 The DPRK Foreign Ministry declares as follows in connection with the grave infringement upon the right of the sovereign state to launch satellites for peaceful purposes:
					
					 Firstly, we resolutely and totally reject the unreasonable behavior of the UNSC to violate the DPRK's legitimate right to launch satellites.
					
					 It is the unshakable principle of the army and people of the DPRK not to tolerate even the slightest element to deride and encroach upon the dignity of the nation and the sovereignty of the country.
					
					 Secondly, we will continue exercising the independent right to use space recognized by the universally accepted international laws which are above the UNSC resolutions.
					
					 We will expand and strengthen space development institutions and continue launching a variety of working satellites needed for economic development of the country including geostationary satellites under the state plan for space development.
					
					 Nothing can stand in the way of the DPRK's space development for peaceful purposes. 
					
					 Thirdly, as the U.S. violated the Feb. 29 DPRK-U.S. agreement through its undisguised hostile acts, we will no longer be bound to it. 
					
					 We have repeatedly clarified from the outset that we will sincerely implement the Feb. 29 agreement to the last and took practical steps to implement it as the satellite launch for peaceful purposes is an issue quite different from the agreement.
					
					 No sooner had the DPRK's plan for satellite launch been announced than the U.S. suspended the process for the provision of food pursuant to the DPRK-U.S. agreement under that pretext. This time, the U.S. spearheaded the hostile act of encroaching upon the DPRK's legitimate right to launch satellites by abusing the position as chairman of the UNSC.
					
					 The U.S. finally reneged on its promise that "it respects the sovereignty of the DPRK and has no hostile intent toward it" in practice, totally violating the Feb. 29 agreement.
					
					 We have thus become able to take necessary retaliatory measures, free from the agreement. The U.S. will be held wholly accountable for all the ensuing consequences.
					
					 Peace is very dear for us but the dignity of the nation and the sovereignty of the country are dearer for us.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Zimbabwean President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Zimbabwean President
 Pyongyang, April 17 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greeting to Robert G. Mugabe, president of Zimbabwe, on Tuesday on the 32nd anniversary of the Republic of Zimbabwe. 
					 It wished the president and people successes in the efforts to defend the sovereignty of the country and achieve social and political stability and economic development.

articles.title: Protocol between Governments of DPRK and Russia Inked
articles.content:
Protocol between Governments of DPRK and Russia Inked 
 Pyongyang, April 17 (KCNA) -- The protocol of the 16th meeting of the forestry sub-committee of the inter-governmental committee for cooperation in trade, economy, science and technology between the DPRK and Russia was inked here Tuesday.
					 Present at the signing ceremony were Kim Sang Yun, vice-chairman of the sub-committee from the DPRK side to the committee and officials concerned and members of the delegation of the forestry sub-committee from the Russian side to the committee headed by its Vice-Chairman Valery Prilipov.

articles.title: Art Performance Given at People's Theater on Its Opening
articles.content:
Art Performance Given at People's Theater on Its Opening
 Pyongyang, April 17 (KCNA) -- An art performance "Let Us Not Forget the Pledge Made to the Revolution" was given by the Unhasu Orchestra at the People's Theater to mark its opening on April 17. The theater is a gift General Secretary Kim Jong Il presented to the Korean people on the centenary of the birth of President Kim Il Sung, the Day of the Sun.
					 Among the audience were senior officials of the party, state and army and representatives for the celebrations of the centenary of the birth of the President.
					
					 The performance began with the playing of the national anthem. Put on the stage were prelude "Let Us Not Forget the Pledge Made to the Revolution", male duet and chorus "We Will Defend Han Byol", mixed trio and male chorus "Horse-drawn Sledge Running with Joy", immortal masterpiece "Song of Anti-Japanese War", female solo and female pangchang "I Know It Now", mixed quartet and chorus "Song Devoted to Marshal Kim Il Sung", orchestral music "Glow over Kangson" and other colorful numbers.
					
					 Children presented quartet "We Are Happy", duet "Rainbow over Mangyong Hill", piano and song "We Extend Glory to Father Marshal Kim Jong Il" and chorus "Let Us Become the General's Soldiers", conspicuously decorating the stage.
					
					 The performance reached its climax with female trio and chorus "The Eternal Smile", chorus "Let Korea Go Forward" and immortal revolutionary paean "Song of General Kim Il Sung." They reflected the pledge to glorify the DPRK as eternal Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il's Korea as comrades and comrades-in-arms loyal to the dear respected Kim Jong Un, remembering broad smile of the great men of Mt. Paektu.
					
					 The performance impressively represented the firm will of all the service personnel and people to dynamically advance toward final victory following the landmark of victory provided by Kim Jong Un, flying the sun's flag of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il in the van of the ranks.

articles.title: Meeting of Fund for April Spring Art Festival Held
articles.content:
Meeting of Fund for April Spring Art Festival Held
 Pyongyang, April 17 (KCNA) -- A meeting of fund for the April Spring Friendship Art Festival took place at the People's Palace of Culture on Tuesday.
					 Present there were Vice-Minister of Culture of the DPRK Sim Tong Gol, vice-chairman of the organizing committee of the festival, officials concerned, heads and members of art troupes of various countries, overseas Koreans art troupes and other delegations.
					
					 There were a declaration of the establishment of the fund, a keynote speech, a briefing on the activities of the fund, recommendation of directors of the fund as well as the conferment of certificates upon those who helped make preparations for the festival.
					
					 Speeches were made there.
					
					 They said the festival held in the idea of independence, friendship and peace has served as a grand international art assembly helpful to developing multilateral exchange in culture and arts. 
					
					 The activities of the fund are very important for holding the festival with splendor, they added.
					
					 They underlined the need to steadily improve the contents and style of the fund and the necessity for personages of different social standings of the world and organizations to closely cooperate with one another in the fund's activities in the days ahead, too.

articles.title: Joint Performances of ASFAF Given
articles.content:
Joint Performances of ASFAF Given 
 Pyongyang, April 17 (KCNA) -- Joint performances of the 28th April Spring Friendship Art Festival were given at the Pyongyang Grand Theatre and the Ponghwa Art Theatre on April 17. 
					  Among the audience were Kim Yong Nam, Choe Yong Rim and other senior officials of the party and state, officials of party and power bodies, ministries and national institutions and Pyongyang citizens. 
					
					 The performances were appreciated by overseas compatriots' organizations including the delegation of Koreans in Japan, overseas Koreans, foreign diplomatic envoys here and foreign guests. 
					
					 The performers included the Chinese art troupe (song and dance ensemble of the General Political Department of the Chinese People's Liberation Army), Chinese circus group, female musicians Anakaona of Cuba, Army Ensemble of Mongolia, dance troupe of Kiev Dance Theatre, female trio "Appasionante" of Italy, "Surya Vocalia" of Indonesia, art troupe of the State Song and Dance Theatre of Vietnam and Quartet of Finland. 
					
					 Foreign artistes presented mixed chorus of immortal revolutionary hymn "Song of General Kim Il Sung", female chorus "Song of Loyalty", female solo "Attraction" and mixed chorus "Footstep" in boundless reverence for President Kim Il Sung, General Secretary Kim Jong Il and the dear respected Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 Also put on the stages were female trio "Habanera" from the opera "Carmen", male quartet "Boys Have Appeared on the Road Again," mixed chorus "I Cannot Tell It Yet" and other numbers. 
					
					 Overseas Korean artistes in male solo "His Ideal", female solo "Think of the General" and other numbers vividly represented the strong yearning for leader Kim Jong Il, who made forced march of high intensity till the last moments of his life for the beloved people that President Kim Il Sung put under his care. 
					
					 Dance "Footstep of Mt. Paektu" made the audience take firm pledges to successfully accomplish the revolutionary cause of Juche under the leadership of Kim Jong Un, holding the peerlessly great persons of Mt. Paektu in high esteem for all ages.
					
					 Floral baskets were conveyed to the performers in congratulation of their successful performances.

articles.title: Russia's Circus Proves Successful in Art Festival
articles.content:
Russia's Circus Proves Successful in Art Festival 
 Pyongyang, April 17 (KCNA) -- The Circus of State Acrobatic Company of Russia is one of the attractions in the 28th April Spring Friendship Art Festival now under way in Pyongyang.
					 Its program includes "Seesaw" and "Combined Music".
					
					 The circus, with a long history, embraces acrobats from several acrobatic troupes in Russia, including merited and people's artistes.
					
					 They won acclamation in various international circus festivals.
					
					 Head of the circus Nikolai Nikolayevichi Naumov told KCNA they came to Pyongyang to adorn President Kim Il Sung's 100th birth anniversary more significantly. 
					
					 He said: 
					
					 "The current festival is being held on a high level. We know many things about the culture of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea and highly admire them.
					
					 The friendly relations between Russia and the DPRK have a long history and tradition."

articles.title: Chinese Acrobats Pleased to Take Part in Pyongyang Art Festival: Head of Circus Troupe
articles.content:
Chinese Acrobats Pleased to Take Part in Pyongyang Art Festival: Head of Circus Troupe
 Pyongyang, April 17 (KCNA) -- One of attractions in the
					28th April Spring Friendship Art Festival now under way in Pyongyang is the acrobatics presented by a Chinese circus troupe.
					
					 Head of the Chinese circus troupe Litie Jin told KCNA:
					
					 I deem it my highest pride to participate in the festival, which is held on the occasion of President Kim Il Sung's 100th birth anniversary.
					
					 The festival serves as an event which helps deepen friendly feelings between peoples of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea and other countries.
					
					 It is out of deep reverence for Kim Il Sung that a number of artistes are participating in the festival.
					
					 Kim Il Sung is always alive in the hearts not only of the Korean people but the Chinese people and other world's progressives.
					
					 We came here with top-level acrobatic pieces worthy to represent China's overall circus.
					
					 I sincerely hope that the festival will be held in a larger scale in the future.
					
					 The Chinese circus troupe is well known worldwide.
					
					 It won scores of prizes in various international circus festivals.
					
					 It made performance tours of more than 120 countries and regions.

articles.title: Foreign Diplomats Visit Venue of Kimilsungia Festival
articles.content:
Foreign Diplomats Visit Venue of Kimilsungia Festival
 Pyongyang, April 17 (KCNA) -- Officials in charge of cultural and friendly relations of foreign embassies here visited the venue of the 14th Kimilsungia Festival Tuesday on the occasion of the centenary of the birth of President Kim Il Sung.
					 They looked round the beautiful flowers in full bloom thanks to deep reverence of the Korean people and other progressives of the world for the President as the eternal sun of Juche.
					
					 At the end of the visit Roselin Bin Rajab, Malaysian councilor, said on behalf of those diplomats that the visit to the festival venue offered them an opportunity to know better about the personalities of the President and General Secretary Kim Jong Il as great men.
					
					 He noted that the President, the founder of the immortal Juche idea, demonstrated the might of the DPRK as a great country.
					
					 He hoped that the Korean people would register great success in the building of a thriving nation under the leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Floral Tribute Paid to Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il by Foreign Guests, Overseas Koreans
articles.content:
Floral Tribute Paid to Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il by Foreign Guests, Overseas Koreans
 Pyongyang, April 17 (KCNA) -- Foreign guests and overseas Koreans taking part in the 14th Kimilsungia Festival laid floral baskets before the statues of President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill on April 17 on the occasion of the centenary of the birth of the President.
					 They paid tribute to them after laying the floral baskets.

articles.title: Friendly Meeting with Chinese School Delegation Held
articles.content:
Friendly Meeting with Chinese School Delegation Held 
 Pyongyang, April 17 (KCNA) -- A friendly meeting with the members of the delegation of the Jilin Yuwen High School in China took place at Changdok School on Tuesday. 
					 Present there on invitation were members of the delegation led by its Director He Manli. 
					
					 Present there were Changdok School teachers and students. 
					
					 The guests laid a floral basket before the statue of President Kim Il Sung at the school in humblest reverence and paid tribute to him. 
					
					 Then they looked round historic relics with keen interest, being briefed on the fact that the President experienced the miserable situation of Korea while studying at the school and deeply grasped the precious truth of the revolution.
					
					 They went round different educational facilities of the school. 
					
					 The participants in the meeting talked to one another about the need to boost the relations between the two schools associated with the revolutionary history of President Kim Il Sung and enjoyed an art performance given by students.

articles.title: Commemorative Stamp Issued in DPRK
articles.content:
Commemorative Stamp Issued in DPRK
 Pyongynag, April 17 (KCNA) -- The State Stamp Bureau issued a new stamp to commemorate the 120th birth anniversary of Kang Pan Sok who was an outstanding leader of the Korean women's movement.
					 Born on April 21, 1892, Kang Pan Sok gave a birth to President Kim Il Sung and devoted her all for the emancipation of women during the period of the Japanese colonial rule over Korea.
					
					 Seen in the upper part of stamp are letters "On 120th Birth Anniversary of Kang Pan Sok, Mother of Korea " and "1892-Juche 101 (2012)".
					
					 It pictures Kang Pan Sok standing among members of the Anti-Japanese People's Guerrilla Army, which was organized by Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: "Kim Il Sung's Korea", Special Write-ups to Centenary of His Birth (31)
articles.content:
"Kim Il Sung's Korea", Special Write-ups to Centenary of His Birth (31)
Kim Jong Il Performs Great Feats for Achieving National Reunification and Improving External Relations 
					
					 Pyongyang, April 17 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il, who had led the Democratic People's Republic of Korea with Songun (military-first) politics, performed big feats in the efforts for achieving national reunification and improving relations with other countries.
					
					 In the famous work "Let Us Carry Out the Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung's Instruction for National Reunification" he published in August Juche 86 (1997), Kim Jong Il reaffirmed the will of the Workers' Party of Korea to achieve national reunification on any account, indicating the principles and tasks to that effect.
					
					 His also published the famous work "Let Us Reunify the Country Independently and Peacefully through the Great Unity of the Entire Nation" in April 1998, calling on the entire Korean people to turn out in the efforts for the reunification.
					
					 Thanks to his devoted efforts, an inter-Korean summit was held in Pyongyang in June 2000, the first of its kind in the history of Korea's division, yielding the North-South Joint Declaration, the keynote of which is the idea of reunifying the country by the efforts of the Koreans. 
					
					 This declaration led to connecting of railways and roads between the north and the south, giving a fresh momentum to national reconciliation and cooperation. In line with the declaration, reunification-related events took place in Pyongyang and Seoul one after another, which helped usher in the June 15 era for reunification.
					
					 Another inter-Korean summit was held in 2007, giving a birth to the October 14 declaration, a programme for the implementation of the June 15 north-south joint declaration. 
					
					 Kim Jong Il had brought about remarkable changes in DPRK's external relations.  
					
					 
					
					 Backed by strong military capabilities, he considered sovereignty to be the lifeline in foreign relations in the face of high-handed diplomacy of the imperialists.
					
					 Thanks to his admirable diplomatic activities, friendly ties with other countries have stood on a higher level.
					
					DPRK's victory in the standoff with the U.S. made its allies paying attention to improving their relations with the country.
					
					 A former Japanese prime minister visited Pyongyang to express apology for the damages and losses Japan had inflicted upon Korea during its colonial rule. 
					
					 In step with the tendency, many Western nations opted for establishing diplomatic relations with the DPRK.
					
					 Organizations to study and disseminate Songun idea has increased and events for friendship and solidarity with the Korean people have taken place on a large scale worldwide.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Works Published in Russia, Nepal
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Works Published in Russia, Nepal
 Pyongyang, April 17 (KCNA) -- The Russian Association for Development of Friendship and Cooperation with Foreign Countries published in pamphlet the works of President Kim Il Sung "For a Free and Peaceful New World" and "3. Let Us Reunify the Country Independently and Peacefully" from "Report to the Sixth Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea on the Work of the Central Committee." 
					 "For a Free and Peaceful New World" published on April 29, 1991 stresses the need to destroy the old international order and establish a new fair one and dynamically wage an international joint struggle against aggression and war. It calls for realizing arms reduction and dismantling weapons of mass destruction including nukes and clarifies the idea that victory is guaranteed by solidarity and cooperation among world people. 
					
					 "3. Let Us Reunify the Country Independently and Peacefully" from "Report to the Sixth Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea on the Work of the Central Committee" published on October 10, 1980 reviews the struggle of the WPK for national reunification during the period under review and sets forth tasks for achieving independent and peaceful reunification of the country. 
					
					 It puts forth a new reunification proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo on the three principles for national reunification and lays down the 10-point policy to be carried out by the DFRK. 
					
					 A ceremony of releasing the works was held on April 9. 
					
					  Meanwhile, the organ of the Socialist Journalist Forum of Nepal on April 10 carried the gist of Kim Il Sung's work "Let Us Uphold Independence". 
					
					 The work, published on September 7, 1981 says that upholding independence in the activities of the party and state is required by the present times and the Juche idea is the man-centered philosophy.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Introduced in Ethiopia, Poland
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Introduced in Ethiopia, Poland
 Pyongyang, April 17 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il's work "Kimilsungia Is an Immortal Flower Blooming in the Hearts of Humankind in the Era of Independence" was brought out in pamphlet by the Penguin Printing Press of Ethiopia.
					 A book releasing ceremony took place at the press on Apr. 10.  
					
					 A full text of Kim Jong Il's work "On Strengthening the People's Army and Establishing Social Traits of Attaching Importance to Military Affairs" was posted on the Polish website "The Democratic People's Republic of Korea" on Apr. 11.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Praised by Foreign Political Parties, Organizations
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Praised by Foreign Political Parties, Organizations
 Pyongyang, April 17 (KCNA) -- Political parties and organizations of different countries posted special write-ups on Internet websites on Apr. 9 and 10 in the run-up to the Day of the Sun, birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The Communist Party of Peru "Red Motherland" posted an article on its website, saying:
					
					 President Kim Il Sung is an eternal sun of humankind who is highly praised by all the people as a great leader, eternal President of the DPRK and a master of thought and leadership for his immortal exploits performed for the Korean revolution and the global cause of socialism.
					
					 The Juche idea founded by the President had been successfully carried forward by General Secretary Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 The Communist Party of Peru "Red Motherland" extends warm congratulations to the Workers' Party of Korea and the Korean people on the 100th anniversary of the President's birth. 
					
					 The Young Communist League of Russia said in its article posted on its website that the President, who embarked on the road of revolution in his early days, defeated U.S. and Japanese imperialisms, established a socialist system centered on the popular masses and indicated orientation and ways for national reunification.
					
					 The Finland-Korea Society posted a portrait of smiling Kim Il Sung and a poem praising him written by a famous poet in Finland. 
					
					 The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy posted articles in praise of Kim Il Sung on its website.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Birth Anniversary Marked in Cambodia
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Birth Anniversary Marked in Cambodia 
 Pyongyang, April 17 (KCNA) -- Cambodian media carried special write-ups or aired special programs on April 4 and 5 in celebration of the 100th birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung. 
					 The Cambodian newspaper Pracheachon carried a portrait of smiling President Kim Il Sung and an article titled "In celebration of the 100th birth anniversary of great HE President Kim Il Sung." 
					
					 It said that colorful celebrations were held with splendor not only in the DPRK but also in many countries of the world on the occasion of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung, a prominent great man in the 20th century. 
					
					 The President always mixed with people and shared thoughts and feelings with them, considering believing in people as in Heaven as his maxim and solved all problems in reliance upon them, it said, and went on:
					
					 The President led the Korean revolution to victory without a single mistake and any deviation in pursuing the line. 
					
					 The bottom line of this was his noble career in which he always shared weal and woe with the people, always finding himself among them. 
					
					 The Apsara TV and Radio Broadcasting introduced the exceptional modest and popular personality of the President. 
					
					 It said: As the President believed in people as in Heaven, always mixing with them, he could found such immortal idea as the Juche idea and enjoy the most outstanding prestige as a leader. 
					
					 The President will live forever in the hearts of not only the Korean people but of all the progressives. 
					
					 FM 90.5 Radio said that the feats the President performed by making a great contribution to the human cause of independence will shine forever.

articles.title: Peruvian National Meeting Marks Centenary of Birth of Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Peruvian National Meeting Marks Centenary of Birth of Kim Il Sung
 Pyongyang, April 17 (KCNA) -- A national meeting was held in Peru on April 10 to celebrate the centenary of the birth of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The participants watched a Korean film on the undying feats of the President.
					
					 Speeches were made at the meeting.
					
					 The chairman of the People's Front of Workers, Peasants and Students of Peru who is national coordinator of the Peruvian Preparatory Committee for Celebrating the Centenary of the Birth of President Kim Il Sung said:
					
					 The DPRK has turned into an invincible country, a satellite manufacturer and launcher and a nuclear weapons state under the wise leadership of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 I extend the greatest glory to the peerlessly great men, the paragons of the world socialist movement and the anti-imperialist struggle, representing the feelings of the progressive political parties and people.
					
					 The chairman of the Communist Party of Peru "Red Motherland" noted that the President was not only the great master of idea and theory but the great leader who steered the Korean revolution and the world cause of socialism to victory.
					
					 Those related to revolutionary activities of the great men said that their idea and cause are being successfully carried forward by the dear respected Kim Jong Un, adding that they would loudly sing songs praising the sun generation after generation.
					
					 A congratulatory message to Kim Jong Un was adopted at the meeting.
					
					 Then followed a performance given by Peruvian artistes.

articles.title: Kim Jong Suk Pyongyang Silk Mill Introduced by Chinese TV
articles.content:
Kim Jong Suk Pyongyang Silk Mill Introduced by Chinese TV
 Pyongyang, April 17 (KCNA) -- The Phoenix Satellite TV Holdings Ltd., Hong Kong, China on April 10 introduced the Kim Jong Suk Pyongyang Silk Mill.
					 The mill is associated with the field guidance given by President Kim Il Sung, General Secretary Kim Jong Il and anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk, it said.
					
					 The mill is producing lots of silk every year with its modern equipment, it noted, and went on:
					
					 Kim Jong Il put forth tasks to fling open the gate to a thriving nation till 2012.
					
					 What is important in attaining the goal of building an economic power is to improve the standard of people's living.
					
					 Women workers of the mill are working hard, confident that they can fling open the gate to a thriving nation.

articles.title: Foreign Delegations, Delegates Leave for Home
articles.content:
Foreign Delegations, Delegates Leave for Home
 Pyongyang, April 17 (KCNA) -- Delegations and delegates of study organizations of the Juche idea and guests of honor of different countries and regions left here on Tuesday after attending the World Congress on the Juche Idea held on the occasion of the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung.
					 They were the minister of Cultural Heritage of Guinea, the presidential envoy of Nicaragua, the former prime minister of Bangladesh, the secretary general of the International Institute of the Juche Idea and his party and a delegation of the European Society for the Study of the Juche Idea.
					
					 Also leaving here for home were delegations and delegates of various countries and regions and international bodies that took part in the international festival celebrating the centenary of the President's birth.
					
					 They included the chairman of the South African Association of Friendship and Solidarity with Korean People, a delegation of the Friendship Society Norway－Korea, the general secretary of the Central Committee of the People's Socialist Party of Mexico, a delegation of the Japanese preparatory committee for commemorating the centenary of the birth of the President, a delegation of the Japanese preparatory committee, the chairman of the Kuwait－DPRK Friendship Association and his party, the delegate president of the France-Korea Friendship Association and his party.
					
					 Departing here earlier were a delegation of the Chinese People's Association for Friendship with Foreign Countries and the China-Korea Friendship Association, a member of the International Kim Il Sung Prize Council and the chairman of the International Kim Il Sung Foundation.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un se retrata con constructores del Teatro del Pueblo
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un se retrata con constructores del Teatro del Pueblo
Pyongyang, 17 de abril (ACNC) -- Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, se fotografio con los constructores militares y los disenadores que edificaron magnificamente el Teatro del Pueblo como obra monumental de la epoca del Songun con motivo del centenario del natalicio del Presidente Kim Il Sung.
					Le acompanaron en esta ocasion Choe Ryong Hae, Jang Song Thaek, Hyon Chol Hae y Kim Won Hong.
					
					Tras felicitar calurosamente a los constructores militares y los disenadores quienes realizaron orgullosas proezas de trabajo dando pruebas del espiritu revolucionario de los militares,             Kim Jong Un tomo una foto de recuerdo con ellos.
					
					Volvio a evaluar sus brillantes proezas diciendo que ellos demostraron patentemente a todo el mundo el poderio de la Corea del Juche y contribuyeron enormemente a la prosperidad del pais al levantar anteriormente muchas magnificas creaciones monumentales.
					
					Se mostro muy satisfecho de que ellos hayan materializado cabalmente el legado del Dirigente Kim Jong Il al construir en menos de un ano el Teatro del Pueblo.
					
					El Dirigente Kim Jong Il pensaba edificar el Teatro del Pueblo desde hace mas de 10 anos y prestaba especial atencion a su obra en el ultimo periodo de su vida para prepararlo como un regalo de fidelidad dedicado al centenario del natalicio del Presidente Kim Il Sung y una creacion para el pueblo.
					
					El Maximo Dirigente expreso su esperanza y conviccion de que los constructores militares y los disenadores seguiran contribuyendo activamente a la causa de construccion de un Estado prospero trabajando con abnegacion patriotica y heroismo masivo en la construccion del socialismo.

articles.title: MINREX denuncia proceder de Consejo de Seguridad de ONU
articles.content:
MINREX denuncia proceder de Consejo de Seguridad de ONU
Pyongyang, 17 de abril (ACNC) -- El Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea hizo publica este martes la siguiente declaracion:
					Estados Unidos y sus fuerzas satelites volvieron a cometer el acto hostil a violar el derecho de la RPDC al lanzamiento de satelites abusando del Consejo de Seguridad de la ONU.
					
					El dia 16, el Consejo de Seguridad de la ONU hizo publica la declaracion de presidente destinada a "condenar" el lanzamiento de satelite de la RPDC con fines pacificos.
					
					De punta a cabo, la RPDC ha tomado las medidas excepcionales que demuestran al maximo la veracidad y la transparencia de dicho lanzamiento, lo cual provoco la simpatia de la amplia sociedad internacional.
					
					EE.UU. recurrio a viles artimanas para calificar el lanzamiento de satelite con fines pacificos de lanzamiento de misil de largo alcance de modo que no se compruebe de modo imparcial el caracter pacifista del lanzamiento de la RPDC. Fracasada tal maquinacion para encubrir la verdad, el imperio impuso al Consejo de Seguridad de la ONU la demanda bandidesca de que la RPDC no debe lanzar tampoco el satelite con fines pacificos.
					
					El mencionado consejo fue y es abusado por el despotismo y arbitrariedades de EE.UU., debido a lo cual la consecuencia catastrofica se engendra diariamente en distintas partes del mundo.
					
					Las resoluciones no. 1718 y no. 1874 del Consejo de Seguridad de la ONU, que las fuerzas hostiles cuestionan el lanzamiento de nuestro satelite como "fundamento", devienen el producto de despotismo que hostiliza y oprime a la RPDC, y climax  ilegalidad inventada a su manera menospreciando hasta las elementales leyes internacionales.
					
					La esencia bandidesca de dichas resoluciones es hacer que el pais, que no obedece a EE.UU., no desarrolle el poderio de defensa nacional y para ese efecto le quite hasta el derecho a lanzar los satelites con fines pacificos.
					
					Tal acto violador de doble pauta se comprendio facilmente en el citado consejo porque conviene a los intereses de los paises que intentan monopolizar las tecnologias sofisticadas como el lanzamiento de satelite.
					
					La situacion de hoy demuestra fehacientemente que es disfraz el principio de igualdad de soberania reflejada en la Carta de la ONU y que la justicia debe ser defendida solo por sus propias fuerzas.
					
					En relacion con que fue violado seriamente el derecho del estado soberano al lanzamiento de satelites con fines pacificos, el Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores de la RPDC declara como sigue:
					
					Primero, Rechazamos tajantemente el proceder injusto del Consejo de Seguridad de la ONU que trata de pisotear el legitimo derecho de la RPDC a lanzar los satelites.
					
					Nuestro ejercito y pueblo mantienen el invariable principio de no tolerar jamas cualquier intento minimo de burlar y atentar la dignidad de la nacion y la soberania del pais.
					
					Segundo, seguiremos ejerciendo el independiente derecho al uso del cosmos reconocido por las universales leyes internacionales, que estan por encima de la resolucion del Consejo de Seguridad de la ONU.
					
					Conforme al plan estatal de desarrollo del cosmos, la RPDC ampliara los organos de desarrollo espacial y seguira lanzando los satelites de usos practicos de diferentes tipos indispensables al desarrollo economico del pais incluyendo el satelite estacionario.
					
					No podra detener con nada el camino de la RPDC que conquista con vigor el cosmos para fines pacificos.
					
					Tercero, la RPDC no estara sujetada por mas tiempo al acuerdo RPDC-EE.UU. del 29 de febrero quebrantado por el abierto acto de hostil del imperio.
					
					Desde el principio, la RPDC aclaro reiteradamente la posicion de ejecutar sinceramente dicho acuerdo ratificando que el lanzamiento de satelite con fines pacificos es el problema aparte con el acuerdo del 29 de febrero y por eso tomo medidas practicas reales.
					
					Pero, tan pronto como se publico el plan de la RPDC de lanzar el satelite, EE.UU. interrumpio el proceso de suministro de provisiones conveniente al acuerdo RPDC-EEUU pretextandolo, y atento el justo derecho de lanzamiento de satelite de la RRPDC abusando de la posicion del presidente del Consejo de Seguridad de la ONU.
					
					En fin de cuentas, rompio completamente el acuerdo RPDC-EE.UU. del 29 de febrero revolcando con acciones su promesa de "respetar la soberania y no tener la voluntad de hostilidad".
					
					Por eso, la RPDC llego a tomar a su antojo las contramedidas necesarias libre del acuerdo RPDC-EE.UU., y EE.UU. se responsabilizara totalmente de las consecuencias que se emanen de ello.
					
					Para la RPDC la paz es valiosa. Pero, la dignidad de la nacion y la soberania del pais son mas valiosas.
